reviewText: Daydreamer is loads of fun - if you are ever feeling nostalgic for an intense shoot-em up platformer but want a new visual flavor that is nothing like most games out there, this is for you. The art in this game is other-worldly and trippy, and it's a blast to tear through the twisted alien armies that vary from Fluffy laser bunnies to alien ghosts to cylon-esque robots.\n\nBoss fights are the set pieces here, with each boss requiring a different strategy - and man are they all weird as hell (in a good way). There is decent replay-ability due to the timing and score" you can achieve from taking the bosses down quickly or without taking too much damage. The different pets you can buy add depth to the way you can approach the games' challenges - just try to remember to save up the yellow "currency" in the beginning
date: so you can afford the more expensive and interesting pets. Some of them are downright hilarious - a flying cat that shoots and screeches? Yes please."

reviewText: Very interesting art style.  The pace is a little slow, but it picks up as you move along.  The mechanics are creative and solid.\n\nAs other reviewers noted, it's geared towards using a gamepad, and you might find the controls unintuitive otherwise, though you can look them up in the options menu.

reviewText: Wow, this game is an awesome mash up of sci-fi and horror elements, with some really bizarre looking enemies. It's fast paced, with cool weapons and moves like the warp.

reviewText:
It's kinda creepy but I dig it :)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aRtL0VWaA8M
Graphics: Yay
Interesting artwork with really creepy looking bosses. This is the stuff nightmares are made of.

Sound: Yay
The music has a heavy retro/synthwave feel to it which goes along well with the other elements of the game.

Gameplay: Yay
A gamepad is highly suggested. Almost every button does something. This allows for a variety of ways to approach and attack.

Overall: Buy
It's creepy, it has variety, and it's fun.

reviewText: I really love the unique artstyle of this game. Monster design is so out of this world and simply hillarious.\nThere is some controls confusion (when you plan on a keyboard), but you can overcome it. You should try this one!

reviewText: This game is awesome. It brought me back to a time when games gave you that warm tingle of being immersed in a unique world. The art direction, and combat come together to create a game that is super fun to play.

reviewText:
I really wanted to love this as I am a huge fan of games like Abe's Oddysee and other quirky platformers.  As it is though, it's more of a $5 game.  Still needs some work.

Pros
-Awesome graphics
-Very interesting style
-Controls are responsive

Cons
-Confusing controls
-Uninteresting story
-Bad checkpoint system
-Annoying camera
-Strange main character

reviewText:
I really liked the art style.  I don't think I've ever seen a game with sprites this good and such smooth animation.  Really great.

The character designs were cool too.  Nice music and atmosphere.

Overall cant recommend due to camera zoomed way too close in - too many leaps of faith and the controls don't really seem appropriate for keyboard.  If i had a gamepad maybe its worth buying at this price.

reviewText: Extremely mind-blowing creative graphics in this game, and great maze-like challenges on multiple levels. An interesting Spirit Guide" following you everywhere gives this game an edge unrivaled by most games of this type.  Very cool!"
